Module kivakit.core
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.registry

Interface RegistryTrait

All Known Subinterfaces:
Component, ComponentMixin, SettingsStore
All Known Implementing Classes:
Application, BaseComponent, BaseResourceSettingsStore, BaseSettingsStore, CoreUnitTest, Deployment, DeploymentSet, EmailMessageAlarm, GsonObjectSerializer, GsonSerializationProject, KivaKit, KryoUnitTest, MemorySettingsStore, Project, PropertiesSerializationProject, Registry, ResourceFolderSettingsStore, Server, Settings, SettingsObject, SettingsProject, UnitTest
public interface RegistryTrait

A stateless trait for accessing the Registry for the implementing component. Includes methods to look up, register and require settings objects. When there is more than one settings object of a given type, an InstanceIdentifier can be given to distinguish between instances. Convenience methods are provided to create instance identifiers for Enums and Strings. The Component interface in kivakit-component uses this trait to add easy access to registry methods to all components.

Lookup methods

  • lookup(Class) - Locates the registered instance of the given class
  • lookup(Class, String) - Locates the specified registered instance of the given class
  • lookup(Class, Enum) - Locates the specified registered instance of the given class

Register methods

  • register(Object) - Registers the given object
  • register(Object, String) - Registers the given identified object instance
  • register(Object, Enum) - Registers the given identified object instance

Require methods

  • require(Class) - Locates the registered instance of the given class or fails
  • require(Class, String) - Locates the specified registered instance of the given class or fails
  • require(Class, Enum) - Locates the specified registered instance of the given class or fails
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

      Retrieves the registry for the component implementing this trait
      Returns:
      The lookup registry for this component

    • require

      default <T> T require(Class<T> type, Factory<T> factory)
      If the given type cannot be found in the registry with lookup(Class), an instance is created using the given factory and registered with register(Object). The value is then returned.
      Parameters:
      type - The type that's required
      factory - A factory for creating the type if it can't be found
      Returns:
      The required value
